result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam R Bileck

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam R Bileck appeared by video, in custody from Columbia County.  Attorney Matthew Murray for Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for Adam R Bileck.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests one more status, last status. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Writ of Habeas Corpus filed with court.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:02PM (64-06) Defendant Adam R Bileck appeared by video, in custody from Walworth County Jail.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for Adam R Bileck.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Attorney Singh Jr., acknowledged the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.

Adj. 2:04PM
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM (64-06)  Defendant Adam R Bileck appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Sarvan Singn Jr., in court for and with Adam R. Bileck  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, Andrew Herrmann in court.
State called to the stand as a witness, Sgt. Wilbert Kennedy from Bloomfield Police Dept.
Wilbert Kennedy duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann.
Witness has identified the defendant on the screen in the courtroom. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:05PM - Cross examination by Attorney Singh.
2:13PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann.
2:14PM - No argument by Attorney Singh.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 


State is requesting 30 days for Arg.  Aug 29, 2022 at 2PM before Comm. Navis.
Time limits are waived.

Adj. 2:17PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam R Bileck in court, in custody.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. in court for Adam R Bileck. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant is being held on another matter.  Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
